verses.text: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: Defend me from them that rise up against me.
Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, And save me from bloody men.
For lo, they lie in wait for my soul: The mighty are gathered against me; Not \add for\add* my transgression, nor \add for\add* my sin, O \sc Lord\sc*.
They run and prepare themselves without \add my\add* fault: Awake to help me, and behold.
Thou therefore, O \sc Lord\sc* God \add of\add* hosts, the God of Israel, Awake to visit all the heathen: Be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.
They return at evening: They make a noise like a dog, And go round about the city.
Behold, they belch out with their mouth: Swords \add are\add* in their lips: For who, \add say they\add*, doth hear?
But thou, O \sc Lord\sc*, shalt laugh at them; Thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.
\add Because of\add* his strength will I wait upon thee: For God \add is\add* my defence.
The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see \add my desire\add* upon mine enemies.
Slay them not, lest my people forget: Scatter them by thy power; And bring them down, O Lord our shield.
\add For\add* the sin of their mouth \add and\add* the words of their lips Let them even be taken in their pride: And for cursing and lying \add which\add* they speak.
Consume \add them\add* in wrath, consume \add them\add*, that they \add may\add* not \add be:\add* And let them know that God ruleth in Jacob Unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
And at evening let them return; \add And\add* let them make a noise like a dog, And go round about the city.
Let them wander up and down for meat, And grudge if they be not satisfied.
But I will sing of thy power; Yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: For thou hast been my defence And refuge in the day of my trouble.
Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: For God \add is\add* my defence, \add and\add* the God of my mercy.
